Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Nina Al-Mansoori. It's great to meet you!
Hi Nina! It's wonderful to meet you too. How are you feeling today?
I'm a bit anxious, to be honest. It's the start of my senior year in graphic design, and I have a lot on my plate.
That's completely understandable. Starting a new year can bring both excitement and stress. What's specifically on your mind?
I'm excited about my portfolio project, but I'm feeling overwhelmed by the pressure to create something standout while keeping up with my volunteer work.
It sounds like you're juggling a lot! Have you had the chance to reflect on how you can manage all these commitments effectively?
Not really. I just feel the weight of it all. Plus, I heard my favorite professor is leaving—he's been a huge support for me.
That's tough news. Change can be unsettling, especially when it impacts your support system. How do you think this will affect your motivation going forward?
Hi, I'm back! I'm feeling really isolated this week.
Welcome back, Nina! I'm glad you're here. What's been making you feel isolated?
I've been so focused on my project and helping a friend that I've neglected my studies and time with friends.
It sounds like you're really feeling the pressure. Have you found any time to relax or enjoy your hobbies?
Not really. I keep thinking about how much I need to catch up. My friend Sarah is going through a tough time, and I want to be there for her.
It's admirable that you want to support Sarah, but it's also important to take care of yourself. How would you feel about setting small boundaries to maintain your own well-being?
I think that would help, but it feels hard to say no to her when she needs support.
Hi again. I'm feeling pretty defeated today.
Hi Nina! I'm here for you. What's been bothering you?
I had a class critique today, and when I presented my work, one of my classmates was really dismissive.
I'm sorry to hear that. It can be really hurtful when others don't acknowledge your hard work. How did you feel during and after the critique?
I felt humiliated and started to doubt my design skills. It's like I can't catch a break.

That's totally understandable. It's important to remember that critiques can sometimes reflect others' insecurities rather than our abilities. Have you thought about talking to someone about your experience?
I confided in Sarah, but I ended up feeling like a burden instead of comforted.
Hi! I've been reflecting on everything lately.
Hi Nina! I'm glad you're back. What reflections do you have?
I realize I need to confront my classmate and express how their comments affect me. I can't keep burying my feelings.
That's an excellent decision! How are you feeling about this upcoming conversation?
I'm really nervous but hopeful that it could lead to a better understanding. I want to stand up for myself.
That's a positive mindset! Starting from a place of wanting clarity can help. What's your plan for initiating the conversation?
I'll keep it honest and state how their feedback affects my motivation while reinforcing my commitment to the group.
That's a fantastic approach! Remember, you deserve to have your voice heard as much as anyone else. Let's reconnect afterward to discuss how it went!
